sub_title: project management | creative strategist | educational policy development | stakeholder engagement
summary:
As a highly motivated and results orientated project manager, I have always demonstrated my skill-sets to ensure both my freelance creative work has been consistent and that my diligence working within larger organizations has remained exemplary. I moved to the Gelderland region of the Netherlands in late  2020.

I have a particular ability in communicating cultural and artistic projects to the public, experience in audience networks & engagment, developing new relationships between the not-for-profit organizations and the public as well as a keen focus on developments in the higher education sector & innovative technologies in the Arts.

certifications.name: Create in Public Space Course
certifications.authority: FAI-AR / Formation supérieure d'art en espace public

company.name: FAI-AR - Formation supérieure d'art en espace public

profile_positions.description:
Coordinator for the immersive circle & digital media  at the Academy for Theater & Dance ArtEZ University of the Arts. The immersive circle project seeks expose students at the academy to the possibilities of new media in the performing Arts,  improve the quality of education creative technologies at the academy and look to the future of education in the performing arts. It also acts as an advisory panel to support the implementation of policy at the academy for theater & dance.

The role facilitates the creation of a digital community (both live & online) and supports students to further their digital creativity & develop their artistic craft. This is achieved through a series of workshops, specialized curated project weeks, live & digital events, equipment purchases and collaborations with experts in the field.

The project, funded through the dutch government via the quality agreements for ArtEZ,  seeks to further improve students experience and facilitate further innovation.
profile_positions.title: project coordinator - immersive circle & digital media

profile_positions.description: Program assistant for the Artisteducator in Theater programme at ArtEz University of the Arts including responsibilities for contract oversight, event scheduling, education programme planning, administration and partnership development for program projects.
profile_positions.title: Projectmedeweker

profile_positions.description:
Digital coordinator for "Ceangal | Dolen II" conference in November. The conference brings together industry figures in theatre working in Irish, Scots Gaelic, and Welsh. 

The conference created a platform by which artists and practitioners could attend key note addresses, artist panels, policy discussions and develop new initiatives & collaborations through their own native languages. This year's conference has gone entirely online and involves coordination of digital platforms such as Whova, Zoom and Mural.
profile_positions.title: Ceangal | Dolen II -Digital Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Techspace is a national movement that aims to change the lives of young people in
Ireland by becoming Ireland's leading creative technology network for outcome-focused
youth development. Techspace is a subsidiary company of Camara Education Ireland.

I took on a new role as a Digital Media Education officer in the company in March of 2019. The role offered new opportunities to expand my skill set, achieve new goals, and undertake new opportunities. Responsibilities included:

• Leading on the curriculum design and development at 2nd & 3rd level Digital Media Education. 
This included devising a 3rd level curriculum content in curation and digital media collaboration with Maynooth Unversity Ireland, development of a 40-hour mobile journalism curriculum resource for secondary school teachers, and development of new training content for Techspace. 

• Management of a Government grant scheme of €283,000 for digital equipment for schools in rural & urban youth settings, management of 50 Adobe Creative Cloud Licences for Youth Clubs and staff, management of 50+ customer sales and supports through the CRM SalesForce. 

• Facilitating 35 training courses in total all over Ireland, managing equipment hires from our Maker Space, and managing social media platforms (Facebook & Instagram)  for Clár Techspace related content increasing our online reach by 30% in 3 months.

• Coordinating the management of the 1st all Irish Language MakerSpace for young people in Ireland including equipment rentals, creating workshops and summer camps, recording youth bands and podcasts and organising adult training sessions in the space.
profile_positions.title: Digital Media Education Officer

profile_positions.description:
Techspace is a national movement that aims to change the lives of young people in
Ireland by becoming Ireland's leading creative technology network for outcome-focused
youth development. Techspace is a subsidiary company of Camara Education Ireland. 
In my capacity as the company's event production manager my responsibilities included:

• Project manager for Techspace's x2 largest tech events yearly-The Tech
Féile & the ESB Creative Tech Fest as well as coordination of smaller taster events throughout the year. 

•Both events yearly hosted 400+ young people & guests, 16 different award categories in STEAM & Digital Media & facilitated groups from all 26 counties in the Republic of Ireland by 2019. 

• Coordination per event of 30+ vendors, 26 workshops, 3 musical acts, creation of risk assessments & traffic management plans for events, coordination of buses to and from the event for groups, coordination of production teams (lighting, sound, stage) for the event. 

• Developing strategic partner relationships with both corporate funders (Google, ESB, Shannon Airport Group) and state agency funders (Dept of Culture, Heritage & the Gaeltacht) through ongoing meetings, delivering targets, direct input on localized sponsorship campaigns for events at a local and national level.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was the production manager for the theatrical production of  "Baoite" by Darach Mac Con Iomaire which premiered at Galway International Arts Festival in 2018 and went on to another sell-out run of the production at The Abbey Theatre in Dublin in 2019.  

The role involved a variety of skills including hiring various vendors, management of production budget,  transportation logistics and risk assessments. 
Goals achieved included:
•Planning and executing 26 successful show run in x 2 national venues. 
•Tailer designed donor events for the production -opening night receptions, invitations, and solicitations. 
•Managing all aspects of visitor services, delivering briefings and evacuation procedures. 
•Delivering on time & under budget with  €100,000 budget outline per production.
profile_positions.title: Production Manager

company.name: Cowles Center for Dance and the Performing Arts

profile_positions.company: Cowles Center for Dance and the Performing Arts
profile_positions.description:
The Cowles Center provides nine rehearsal studios, three theatres, and administrative office space to 26 leading dance and performing arts organizations and is the Midwest’s largest not-for-profit dance complex.  My responsibilities included: researching new donors, solicitation of gifts, event management, social media content development, grant research, and support.
Key achievements included:
• Developed 50 new donor relationships in x3 months through telemarketing solicitations and online communications. 
•Content creation across three platforms during the marketing campaign for the company’s Give to the Max Day in 2017, the most competitive digital marketing day for not-for-profits in Minnesota. Increased social media interactions 20% over a single day on x3 platforms. 
•Developed an in-depth knowledge Raiser’s Edge software, corporate sponsorship, & U.S. Not-For-Profit managerial structures.
•Managed a team of 14 volunteers, coordination of 80 silent auction lots and production support to the main event and gala dinner, successfully executing the company's yearly fundraising gala goal of $1.5 million
profile_positions.title: Junior Development Associate

profile_positions.description:
Assistant production manager for Jungle Theater over the course of three of their Winter/Spring season productions. Included processing timesheets, production budgeting and staff scheduling, internal office administration, contractual and legal administration, Gala-event management & planning. Achievements include:
-Coordination of production team of 12 for x3 productions with production costs of $85,000 per show.
-Coordination of Gala Fundraising event raising $560,000 for the theater.
-Implementation of the First Aid course for all staff at the Theater. 
-Support role in solicitation for the theater, management of administration for the 400+ donor database for theater.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Production Manager

profile_positions.description:
Branar are on of Ireland's leading theatre companies with a special focus on theatre for children. 
As a producer for their first-ever early years production & international tour, I was responsible for scheduling and coordinating a three-month tour of Scotland and Ireland, ensuring the company stayed within budget and outlined commitments to presenting venues and Festivals. 

This involved liaising with our international partners, supervising the day to day administration, and liaising with presenting venues and festivals. I also played a pivitol role in planning and organising the following year's tour, undertaking the Arts Council Touring application and negotiating with the 10 partner venues.
profile_positions.title: Company Producer

profile_positions.description: Working as part of a dedicated box office team in one of the busiest regional Irish theatre venues, the Town Hall Theatre. Responsibilities include dealing with customer queries, high administrative & clerical skills, problem-solving and knowledge of the Arts. Coordinating with visiting Festivals and companies and in-depth knowledge of our CRM system and office suite such as Microsoft Word, Exel and Powerpoint.
profile_positions.title: Box Office Assistant-Town Hall Theatre

profile_positions.description:
Galway Theatre Festival annual showcases a 9-day spectacle of theatre, circus, storytelling and performance in Ireland’s Festival capital. I worked with GTF during a pivotal time of change for the Festival supporting a new director to overhaul the Festival aesthetic and financial deficits. 
Key achievements included:
•Creation and implementation of 4 tiered sponsorship package for businesses soliciting €15,000 in sponsorship for the festival. 
• Coordinated all major PR events-  Festival launches, donor events, TV & Radio appearances, Festival Club, and volunteer management plans. 
•Developed social media campaigns across x3 platforms developed successful #growgalwaytheatre campaign for local businesses, devised & directed cinematic ad campaign for 2015 (attached), increased online traffic by 35% accross x3 social media platforms.
profile_positions.title: Chief Fundraiser & Development Manager

company.name: Arts Council of Ireland / An Chomhairle Ealaíon

profile_positions.company: The Arts Council / An Chomhairle Ealaíon
profile_positions.description:
During a six-week internship at the Arts Council of Ireland, I was put in charge of a pilot project for data analysis within the Touring department of the Arts Council of Ireland. Opportunities to
work within the Arts Council are few and the roles gave me excellent insight into the workings of a large government body, departmental issues related to the Arts and the
process of grants applications. Key achievements included:

• Integrating a competent knowledge of Microsoft Excel into my data input.

• Learning how to manage complex government-level CRM systems.

• Compiling a report of my findings during my internship for internal future reference.

• Presenting a PowerPoint presentation of my research to heads of department of the Arts
Council.

• Undertaking an in-depth research and analysis of Arts Council Policies and history to better inform my final report and presentation to the heads of Department.
profile_positions.title: Research And Policy Analyst

volunteer_experiences.description: I have been a contributing board member of Áras na Gael in Galway City for over 1 year. The role has been in an advisory capacity to the financial management of the organization and strategic planning in the areas of education, event management and preservation of the Irish language in the 21st Century.

Theatre57 is a collective of over 90 Galway-based independent* theatre artists advocating for investment in sustainability and infrastructure to support independent theatre in Galway City. We first came together in May 2018, to discuss the challenges and benefits of making work in and agreed that a pro-active approach was required to drive change in the sector. 
The role involved alot of liasing with local authorities, fundraising and event management, creating governance structures and understanding of the not-for-profit sector and liasing with the wider membership in forming the aims and goals of the group. I remain a pro-active member after stepping down from the board in January.

company.name: The National Campaign for the Arts

volunteer_experiences.description: The National Campaign for the Arts is a volunteer-led, grassroots movement that makes the case for the arts in Ireland. We work to ensure that the arts are on national and local government agendas and are recognized as a vital part of contemporary Irish life.

I worked with Volunteer Service International in the northern Kenyan village of Kitale for three months.  Primarily our responsibilities included teaching in a local secondary school and working in the evenings at an orphanage outside the village.
